Sparkline

The Kendo Sparkline for PHP is a server-side wrapper for the Kendo UI Sparkline widget.

Getting Started

There are two main ways to bind Kendo Sparkline for PHP:

  • local - the sparkline is bound to PHP array
  • remote - the sparkline makes AJAX requests and is bound to JSON result

Here is how to configure the sparkline for local binding:

  1. Follow the steps from the introduction - include the autoloader, JavaScript and CSS files.

  2. Create an array which to which the sparkline will be bound to

     <?php
 $data = array(1, 3, 5, 4, 2);
 ?>

  3. Create a sparkline, configure its data.

     <?php
 $sparkline = new \Kendo\Dataviz\UI\Sparkline('sparkline');
 $sparkline->data($data);
 ?>

  4. Output the sparkline by echo-ing the result of the render method.

     <?php
 echo $sparkline->render();
 ?>

Getting Client-side Reference

You can reference the clien-side Kendo Sparkline instance via jQuery.data(). Once a reference has been established, you can use the API to control its behavior.

Example

<?php
$sparkline = new \Kendo\Dataviz\UI\Sparkline('sparkline');
echo $sparkline->render();
?>
<script>
$(function() {
    // The constructor parameter is used as the 'id' HTML attribute of the sparkline
    var sparkline = $("#sparkline").data("kendoSparkline")
});
</script>

Handling Events

You can subscribe to all Sparkline events.

Example - subscribing by specifying JavaScript function name

<?php
$sparkline = new \Kendo\Dataviz\UI\Sparkline('sparkline');

// The 'sparkline_dataBound' JavaScript function will handle the 'dataBound' event of the sparkline
$sparkline->dataBound('sparkline_dataBound');

echo $sparkline->render();
?>
<script>
function sparkline_dataBound() {
    // Handle the dataBound event
}
</script>

Example - providing inline JavaScript code

<?php
$sparkline = new \Kendo\Dataviz\UI\Sparkline('sparkline');

// Provide inline JavaScript code that will handle the 'dataBound' event of the sparkline
$sparkline->dataBound('function() { /* Handle the dataBound event */ }');

echo $sparkline->render();
?>
